Marco Rubio: s proposal includes a new, partially refundable child tax credit of up to $2,500 per child, which is larger than the current $1,000 credit available.
The nonpartisan Tax Foundation estimated: s tax credit would result in a loss of tax revenue of about $170 billion per year.
The Tax Policy Center: another reputable analysis organization, also estimated a loss of nearly $1.58 trillion in tax revenue over 10 years due to the original tax credit proposal.
The specifics of Rubio: s current proposal, including the phase-out of the credit at higher income levels, have not been analyzed by the Tax Policy Center.
